t: Psalm 132
David and Zion Chosen
A song of ascents.
Lord,*spn remember David and*ln all the hardships he endured,
and*ln how he swore an oath to the Lord,*s making*ln a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:
“I*ln will not enter my house or*ln get into my bed,
I*ln will not allow my eyes to sleep or*ln my eyelids to slumber
until*ln I find a place for the Lord,*s a*ln dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
We*pn heard of the ark in Ephrathah; we*ln found it in the fields of Jaar.
Let’s*ln go to his dwelling place; let’s*ln worship at his footstool.
Rise*ln up, Lord,*s come to your resting place, you*ln and your powerful ark.
May*ln your priests be clothed with righteousness, and*ln may your faithful people shout for joy.
For*ln the sake of your servant David, do*ln not reject your anointed one.
The*pn Lord*s swore an oath to David, a*ln promise he will not abandon: “I*ln will set one of your offspring on*ln your throne.
If*ln your sons keep my covenant and*ln my decrees that I will teach them, their*ln sons will also sit on your throne forever.”
For*pn the Lord*s has chosen Zion; he*ln has desired it for his home:
“This*ln is my resting place forever; I*ln will make my home here because*ln I have desired it.
I*ln will abundantly bless its food; I*ln will satisfy its needy with bread.
I*ln will clothe its priests with salvation, and*ln its faithful people will shout for joy.
There*ln I will make a horn grow for David; I*ln have prepared a lamp for my anointed one.
I*ln will clothe his enemies with shame, but*ln the crown he wears will be glorious.”
